message.content: {"id": "21706", "title": "Bug 21706 - BidiUtil usage of Class.forName() causes NoClassDefFoundError in CLDC version", "description": "The problem with BidiUtil in the win32 version of SWT is that it uses the Class.forName() method which throws a NoClassDefFoundError. This error is not defined in the CLDC class libraries, causing a problem in the CLDC version of SWT. The issue can only be seen when using jxeLink or a similar tool, as the compiler generates the call and assumes that NoClassDefFoundError is available. To resolve this issue, the reflection usage should be removed.", "OB": "The problem with BidiUtil in the win32 version of SWT is that it uses the Class.forName() method which throws a NoClassDefFoundError. This error is not defined in the CLDC class libraries, causing a problem in the CLDC version of SWT.", "EB": "To resolve this issue, the reflection usage in BidiUtil should be removed.", "SR": "Remove the reflection usage in BidiUtil to resolve the NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '21706', 'title': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage', 'description': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage ', 'OB': 'Well, kind of.And so what if it does?OK, 2047 has a line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil of:static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);The BidiUtil.class is syntactic sugar for Class.forName("org...BidiUtil").Theproblem with this is that method throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is notdefined in the CLDC class libraries, which causes us a little problem in theCLDC version of SWT.You\'d only see this problem if you verified or usedjxeLink or something; the compiler gens the call itself, and just assumesNoClassDefFoundError is around, so you won\'t ever get a compiler error from theeclipse compiler (nor Sun\'s compiler).So, I\'d like this changed.Here\'s the simplest way to change to remove thereflection. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
